newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile's Banco Security secures $50 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Chile's Banco Security secures $50 mln loan.

text.p: Chile's Banco Security, part of the Security Holdings group, said it secured a $50 million syndicated loan from a group led by Bank of America.
"Banco Security will use this loan to finance the foreign trade of its clients which has been the bank's traditional sector," General Manager Ramon Eluchans said in a statement on Wednesday.
The loan is for five years at a variable interest rate above the London interbank offered rate, he said.
The bank, one of the country's smallest private banks, reported net earnings of 2.1 billion pesos in the first four months of the year, up 29 percent from the same period last year, he said.
